title: Kawaguchiko → Tokyo
content:
The main reason I wanted to stay around Kawaguchiko was to ride around the lake, and possibly check out some temples along the way.

The place I stayed for the night had reasonable bike rentals, so after I checked out, I rented a bike and got to riding around the lake!

I had to stop a few times to check GPS to get through the small streets and reach the lake, but once I was there it was pretty smooth sailing for the rest of the day. I rode clockwise around the lake from Oike park, stopping at various points to take in the sights, mostly of Fuji hanging in the background.

About ¾ of the way around I reached the main lookout point on the lakeside, with a coffee shop and pretty much perfect views of Fuji, so I stopped and enjoyed a coffee while taking in the scenery!

To wrap up the day around Kawaguchiko by travelling up the ropeway to get a view of the lake and Fuji. This was nice, and gave a good view once up at the top.

I returned the bike and figured out my route back to Tokyo - 5 trains in total, taking about 4 hours in the end! There was some great scenery along the way though - plenty of countryside with small villages and stations before the hussle and bustle of Tokyo again!
